questions.question: What are the PCAF data quality options for motor vehicles?
questions.answer:
**PCAF Motor Vehicle Data Hierarchy - Banking Implementation Guide**

**Option 1: Real Fuel Consumption Data (Score: 1.0)**
```
Data Sources: Telematics systems, fleet fuel cards, fuel management platforms
Banking Application: Commercial fleet financing, equipment leasing portfolios
Implementation Cost: $50-200 per vehicle (hardware + integration)
Regulatory Advantage: Highest credibility for climate stress testing
Credit Enhancement: Supports 10-15 bps rate reduction for green loans
```

**Typical Use Cases:**
â€¢ Large corporate fleet financing facilities (>$10M)
â€¢ Equipment finance divisions with existing telematics infrastructure
â€¢ Leasing companies with comprehensive asset management systems
â€¢ Commercial relationships where real-time data adds credit value

**Option 2: Estimated Fuel Consumption (Score: 2.0)**
```
Data Sources: Annual mileage reporting + EPA fuel economy ratings
Banking Application: Prime auto lending, relationship banking clients
Implementation Cost: $5-15 per loan (data collection and validation)
Regulatory Advantage: Satisfies most supervisory expectations
Risk Management: Enables robust climate scenario modeling
```

**Banking Integration Approach:**
â€¢ Loan servicing system integration for annual mileage tracking
â€¢ Customer portal development for self-service mileage reporting
â€¢ Credit analyst workflow integration for data validation
â€¢ Automated EPA rating lookup through VIN decoding services

**Option 3: Vehicle Specifications + Average Mileage (Score: 3.0)**
```
Data Sources: VIN decoding services + regional/national mileage statistics
Banking Application: Standard auto lending operations at scale
Implementation Cost: $2-5 per loan (automated VIN lookup services)
Regulatory Advantage: Meets PCAF compliance threshold efficiently
Operational Excellence: Scalable process for high-volume lending
```

**Vendor Integration:**
â€¢ Automated VIN decoding in loan origination systems
â€¢ Integration with Experian, Polk, or similar automotive data providers
â€¢ Batch processing capabilities for portfolio remediation
â€¢ API integration for real-time loan booking workflows

**Option 4: Vehicle Type Classification (Score: 4.0)**
```
Data Sources: Basic loan documentation and collateral descriptions
Banking Application: Legacy portfolio remediation and emergency compliance
Implementation Cost: <$1 per loan (manual classification processes)
Regulatory Risk: May require improvement plan if >30% of portfolio
```

**Option 5: Asset Class Average (Score: 5.0)**
```
Data Sources: Outstanding balance and basic asset class identification
Banking Application: Emergency compliance measure only
Implementation Cost: Minimal operational overhead
Regulatory Risk: Supervisory concern if >10% of total portfolio
```

**Strategic Implementation Roadmap:**
```
Year 1: Achieve Option 3 for 80% of portfolio (regulatory compliance)
Year 2: Migrate 50% of commercial portfolio to Option 2 (competitive advantage)
Year 3: Implement Option 1 for fleet financing (market differentiation)
```

**Business Case Summary:**
â€¢ **Regulatory Compliance:** Option 3 minimum for supervisory acceptance
â€¢ **Competitive Advantage:** Options 1-2 enable ESG product differentiation
â€¢ **Risk Management:** Higher quality options support climate stress testing
â€¢ **Capital Efficiency:** Better data quality reduces climate risk capital charges

questions.question: What PCAF score do I need for compliance?

**PCAF Compliance Framework - Supervisory Expectations**

â€¢ **Focus Areas:** Data governance frameworks and independent validation processes
